messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:03): what does the anolis --dump-xrefs option do?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:04): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: The behaviour you complained about earlier looks like a bug to me. What did you use as input?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (13:04): It writes out a JSON file with the xrefs  for other specs to use
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:05): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: that turned out to be pilot error
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:05): Ah, not the kind that causes hundreds of people to plunge to their death I hope
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:06): What did you do? The error message wasn't clear‚Ä¶
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:07): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: I was trying to run anolis from a symlink but I think it was expecting to find stuff in a relative path
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:07): or something
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:08): I fixed it by not running it from a symlink

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:08): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81, so if I have "anolis --dump-xrefs=data/xrefs/dom/url.json Overview.src.html /tmp/spec", it's supposed to writ out a url.json file?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:09): if I run that, I get an error message: "[Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'data/xrefs/dom/url.json'"
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:09): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: any update on that multipage validator bug?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (13:10): It does require a file with { "url": "..." } to be present already
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:10): ah, OK
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:11): ooh, did I never check in url.json?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:11): my bad
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:11): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: shall I check mine in so you can run update?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:11): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: yes please
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (13:12): Documentation for this stuff has been on my todo list for ages :)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:12): was trying to run the build for the URL spec
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:15): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I changed stuff. Did the problem get fixed?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:16): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: updated Makefile and data/
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:16): thanks
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:16): pulls
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:19): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: there was an open bug on the issue but I cannot find it
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:21): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: oh, I guess Hixie has not updated the spec either
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:21): fyi: I'm on vacation starting next week Wednesday
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:22): if anyone can take over WHATWG Weekly until February that would be nice
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:26): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: why again could it be a problem because of your script? because it is not a problem in single-page
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:26): the bug is https://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=12539 btw
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:29): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: thanks for teh docs update
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:29): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: iirc the problem was lxml didn't support the full set of named entities or something
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (13:29): 'twas long overdue
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:29): and lxml is not used for single page?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:30): It is used to parse it, but not serialise it. I guess Hixie doesn't use the named entities in the source
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:31): The flow is Hixie -> single page -> multipage where each -> implies an application of the lxml parser
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:31): ah, so with the second invocation it goes wrong
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:31): thanks
